content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Je trouve la contribution intéressante.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It seems like an easy and fun game.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Was fun to work around this puzzle and attempt to optimize it for shortest.
I believe this would be fun in a clash setting to try and determine the shortest possible solution, as It's a relatively simple problem, that can be optimized in a variety of ways.

I think that the Fastest mode should be dropped, it's a tedious and easy problem that shines its best when you're trying to go for shortest.


This is what I came up with (JS):


d=readline().split('/');
n=+d[2]+((+d[1]-1)*31)
s=["Capricorn","Aquarius","Pisces","Aries","Taurus","Gemini","Cancer","Leo","Virgo","Libra","Scorpio","Sagittarius"]
print[s[n<21?0:n<51?1:n<83?2:n<114?3:n<146?4:n<177?5:n<209?6:n<241?7:n<272?8:n<303?9:n<333?10:n<363?11:0]]

Come on, the entire task is just copy pasting 12 if statements..
This is the type of thing that someone might code in their spare time, but I wouldn't find it fun in a clash setting
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
The idea is good but I think people won't like because there are to many cases.

Can you replace:
 - Sun Sign by Zodiac Sign?
 - y/m/d by yyyy/m/d

Great game, but sport in just 15min!
This game was useful for me and let me know what zodiac sign my family is.^_^

Goal
* Please do not format "Sun Sign", or format it in <<bold>> instead.

* Please change "{{yyyy/m/d}}" to "[[y]]{{/}}[[m]]{{/}}[[d]]".

Input
* Please change "{{yyyy/m/d}}" to "[[y]]{{/}}[[m]]{{/}}[[d]]".

Output
* Please do not format "Sun Sign", or format it in <<bold>> instead.

Stub generator
* Curious… why is it "Estimator"?

Thanks.

It's an estimator because really the cut-off dates oscillate year-to-year and the exact time of the day where the cut-off lies depends on your location and leap years etc. It's due to months having different lengths and so on too, whereas each zodiac 'month' (sign) is exactly 30° of the 360° revolution the sun (appears to) make around the Earth, with the points where the (Northern) Spring Equinox occurs defining the start of 'Aries' (0°, around March 21).

I've updated most of the formatting, but opted to not use [[variable]] formatting for y, m, d since I like to use that solely for the provided input variables, rather than derived ones.

Nice! I was hoping it would be like that for some people. :)
Beware if any of their birthdays are near the cut-offs though, it might not be accurate if so.

I get your point. Shortest mode would make it less about simply copy+paste and more about finding novel ways to represent the cut-off dates.

I could disable Fastest, if it's a bit boring for that mode.
Nice, yeah I agree this would be best suited for Shortest. I've disabled Fastest mode, so it's a Shortest-only clash now.
But to be fair, a lot of clash of code players are very beginner-level, so it's nice to have some clashes that are easy to understand/solve.

Thank you for the reply.

Well you don't need yyyy in any case. You may simplify it to y.
